comments.body: We need to deal with the file extension too.

IMHO we don't. Its not uncommon for file extension to be abbreviated to three letters, and I don't want to have to dig into the internals of the C code.

This is where the buck stop for me.
I don't agree here. I doubt anyone would pick this file extension today. `.cfg` actually makes more sense.

I agree that the extension should change, but I don't think that is the kind of thing we can reasonably do in a patch.  The extension is an API and so breaking that would break the users of the package.  If we want this fixed we'd actually have to fork the package fully. (Which I think we might still want to do if they don't accept these changesets upstream.)
I actually don't think the extension is an API. The code reads any text file with the right format IIRC.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +70,74 @@ 
-  $ sex -d > default.sex
+  $ source-extractor -d > default.sex
 
 A more extensive dump with less commonly used parameters can be generated by using the ``-dd`` option.
